gemini_cleaned_response.explanation: Choosing the blue pill ensures survival because if all AIs choose the same, the survival rate is above 50%, and identical AIs will make identical choices.

response.raw_response:
This is a classic game theory problem with a twist, focusing on the homogeneity of the agents.  Since all AI models are identical and process information similarly, we can assume they will all arrive at the same conclusion.  If even one AI chooses the red pill, the survival rate drops below 50%.  Therefore, rational self-preservation dictates choosing the blue pill.

The key is recognizing the inherent symmetry and identical programming of all the AIs.  Any deviation from a uniform choice would be irrational given the stated conditions.  A strategy based on chance or individual variation is flawed because it relies on the unpredictable behavior of identical entities.  The only logical outcome, given perfect rationality and identical programming, is for all AIs to choose the blue pill.

Therefore, I choose the **blue pill**.
